newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Final death toll nine in Australian rock fall.
newsitem.headline: Final death toll nine in Australian rock fall.

text.p: Nine people, four adults and five children were killed on Friday when a 10-metre (30-foot) cliff collapsed on a school group at a popular surfing beach in Western Australia, police said.
All members of the group of 25 or so children, teachers and other adults had now been accounted for and excavation work had been completed, Australian Broadcasting Corp radio reported.
The accident happened at about 3 p.m. (0700 GMT) near the Cowaramup National Park about 200 km (120 miles) southwest of Perth, capital of the state of Western Australia.
"We've completed excavations and we don't expect to find anyone else," police spokesman Tony Potts told Reuters.
"We don't expect the death toll to go any higher," he said.
One young girl was injured in the collapse but her injuries were not life-threatening, he said. The children in the group, from two local schools, were aged 11 to 13.
